Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: WHITE
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: Defined as Isabelline in the color palette. This is the lightest color that is used for most text. The following values are this color’s representation in various color spaces:

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: CREME
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: Defined as Silver Chalice in the color palette. This is the next color after Isabelline and is used as a highlight color for the UINavigationBar as well as heading text (i.e. large text). The following values are this color’s representation in various color spaces:

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: CHARCOAL
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: Defined as Outter Space in the color palette. This is the next color after Silver Chalice and is used as the background color for GeneralUITextField. The following values are this color’s representation in various color spaces:

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: BACKGROUND
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: Defined as Gunmetal in the color palette. This is the next color after Outter Space and is used as the background color for all of the UIViews in UIViewControllers of type GeneralUIViewController. The following values are this color’s representation in various color spaces:

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: BLACK
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: Defined as Raisin Black in the color palette. This is the next color after Gunmetal and is used as the text color GeneralUILabel found on light backgrounds or more particularly for the LoginButton found on the main page of this application. The following values are this color’s representation in various color spaces:

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: RED
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: Defined as Light Red Ochire in the color palette. This color replaces all Red in the application. It can be used as a GeneralUIButton color, or UIView. This can be seen in the NoiseMeter where this color indicates the loudest audio decibal range. The following values are this color’s representation in various color spaces:

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: GREEN
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: Defined as Very Light Malachite Green in the color palette. This color replaces all Green in the application. It can be used as a GeneralUIButton color, or UIView. This can be seen in the NoiseMeter where this color indicates an audio decibal range. The following values are this color’s representation in various color spaces:

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: PURPLE
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: Defined as Pale Violet in the color palette. This color replaces all Purple in the application. It can be used as a GeneralUIButton color, or UIView. This can be seen in the NoiseMeter where this color indicates an audio decibal range. The following values are this color’s representation in various color spaces:

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: BLUE
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: Defined as Maya Blue in the color palette. This color replaces all Blue in the application. It can be used as a GeneralUIButton color, or UIView. This can be seen in the NoiseMeter where this color indicates an audio decibal range. The following values are this color’s representation in various color spaces:

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: ORANGE
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: Defined as Macaroni and Cheese in the color palette. This color replaces all Orange in the application. It can be used as a GeneralUIButton color, or UIView. This can be seen in the NoiseMeter where this color indicates an audio decibal range. The following values are this color’s representation in various color spaces:

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: FB_BLUE
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: This is the official color designated by Facebook as their Facebook-Blue. This color was used as the background for the custom Facebook GeneralUIButton that shows up on the Login and Create Account ViewControllers. The following values are this color’s representation in various color spaces:

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: GOOGLE_RED
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: This is the official color designated by Google as their Google-Red. This color was used as the background for the custom Google GeneralUIButton that shows up on the Login and Create Account ViewControllers. The following values are this color’s representation in various color spaces:

Extensions/UINavigationBar.html#/s:FE17P.name: setBottomBorderColor(color:height:)
Extensions/UINavigationBar.html#/s:FE17P.abstract: Creates a ‘bottom border’ for the UINavigationBar by creating a new UIView of height height (@param), setting its background color to color (@param) adding it as a subview.

Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.name: BUTTON
Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.abstract: This is the default font that is used by GeneralUIButton objects.

Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.name: LABEL
Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.abstract: This is the default font that is used by GeneralUILabel objects.

Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.name: TEXTFIELD
Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.abstract: This is the default font that is used by GeneralUITextField objects.

Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.name: LOGO
Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.abstract: This is the font that is used by text that appears under the logo on the InitialViewController

Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.name: LARGE
Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.abstract: This is the font that is used by NoiseMeterViewController to display the Noise Level in decibels.

Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.name: CAPTION
Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.abstract: This is the font that is used by NoiseMeterViewController to caption the different colors in the Noise Meter.

Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.name: EQUALIZER
Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.abstract: This is the font that is used by EqualizerViewController to display the different band frequencies.

Classes/User.html#/s:vC17Phase_1_Wirefra.name: data
Classes/User.html#/s:vC17Phase_1_Wirefra.abstract: The data to be stored in the server.

Classes/User.html#/s:vC17Phase_1_Wirefra.name: email
Classes/User.html#/s:vC17Phase_1_Wirefra.abstract: Determines if the user signed in with an email or a phone number

Classes/GeneralUIButton.html#/s:FC17Phas.name: awakeFromNib()
Classes/GeneralUIButton.html#/s:FC17Phas.abstract: Customize appearance of the UIButton object when this function is called. The theme enforces the cornerRadius, backgroundColor, titleColor, and titleLabelFont to be consistent among all GeneralUIButton objects.

Classes/Audio.html#/s:vC17Phase_1_Wirefr.name: audioEngine
Classes/Audio.html#/s:vC17Phase_1_Wirefr.abstract: The engine that is used for all audio effects. AVAudioEngine allows for real time audio editing which let’s the programmer tap the microphone for input then forward all data through different effect chains. Finally, the output of these effect chains can be mixed together through audioMixerNode.

Classes/Audio.html#/s:vC17Phase_1_Wirefr.name: audioPlayerNode
Classes/Audio.html#/s:vC17Phase_1_Wirefr.abstract: This is used if the user recorded on the previous screen. It is set up such that the audio plays in a faux-loop fasion. Rather than using the .loop feature which would repeat an audio buffer endlessly, audio files are scheduled such that when the file ends, UIElemnts are modified before the next audio file gets queued.

Classes/Audio.html#/s:vC17Phase_1_Wirefr.name: audioSession
Classes/Audio.html#/s:vC17Phase_1_Wirefr.abstract: This is used if the user skipped recording on the previous screen. It uses the audioEngine to tap input from the mic and send it to this AVAudioSession to play through the speakers after being manipulated for effects.

Classes/Audio.html#/s:vC17Phase_1_Wirefr.name: audioMixerNode
Classes/Audio.html#/s:vC17Phase_1_Wirefr.abstract: The mixer is used to mix together multichannel audio.

Classes/Audio.html#/s:vC17Phase_1_Wirefr.name: recordedAudio
Classes/Audio.html#/s:vC17Phase_1_Wirefr.abstract: Information regarding the recorded clip from the previous GeneralUIViewController.

Classes/Audio.html#/s:vC17Phase_1_Wirefr.name: audioFile
Classes/Audio.html#/s:vC17Phase_1_Wirefr.abstract: The audio file in which this class attempts to record.

Classes/Audio.html#/s:vC17Phase_1_Wirefr.name: recorder
Classes/Audio.html#/s:vC17Phase_1_Wirefr.abstract: The `AVAudioRecorder’ that performs recording from the microphone.

Classes/Audio.html#/s:vC17Phase_1_Wirefr.name: notificationName
Classes/Audio.html#/s:vC17Phase_1_Wirefr.abstract: A notification that is used to update UIElements in EqualizerViewController.

Classes/Audio.html#/s:C17Phase_1_Wirefra.name: HandlerFunction
Classes/Audio.html#/s:C17Phase_1_Wirefra.abstract: A type alias to allow creating functions that accept other functions as parameters.

Classes/Audio.html#/s:ZvC17Phase_1_Wiref.name: sharedInstance
Classes/Audio.html#/s:ZvC17Phase_1_Wiref.abstract: A sharedInstance that can be used by all other classes. This is reaquired to make this class a singleton.

Classes/Audio.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_Wirefr.name: setupAVAudioSession()
Classes/Audio.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_Wirefr.abstract: Creates an AVAudioSession as a sharedInstance then requests recording permission from the user. If the user allows recording, the AVAudioSession has settings changed and the record method is called.

Classes/Audio.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_Wirefr.name: setupEqualizer(numberOfBands:)
Classes/Audio.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_Wirefr.abstract: Called in other VC’s viewDidLoad, this function sets up the equalizer with 14 bands per channel.

Classes/Audio.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_Wirefr.name: setupAudioEngine(realTime:handler:)
Classes/Audio.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_Wirefr.abstract: This function creates an AVAudioEngine stored in audioEngine. Then based on realTime, it sets up real-time multichannel microphone to speaker output or streams from an audio file. In both of these cases the input is sent to an equalizer that the user may modify. These two channels are then mixed together with audioEngine.mainMixerNode.

Classes/Audio.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_Wirefr.name: schedule()
Classes/Audio.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_Wirefr.abstract: A recursive function that is used to infinitely schedule the same audio clip that was recorded on the previous screen.

Classes/Audio.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_Wirefr.name: recordWithAVAudioRecorder(filename:settings:metered:timeIntervalForResults:)
Classes/Audio.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_Wirefr.abstract: Sets up the AVAudioRecorder and records into filename (@param) using settings (@param). A time interval is also included as an iterative callback which allows for getting metering results.

Classes/Audio.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_Wirefr.name: startRecordingWithAudioEngine()
Classes/Audio.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_Wirefr.abstract: This function is called if in real-time mode. It starts the recording process and streams the audio to speaker after digital signal processing.

Classes/Audio.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_Wirefr.name: stopRecordingWithAudioEngine()
Classes/Audio.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_Wirefr.abstract: This function is called if in real-time mode. It stops the recording process and stops the audioEngine after removing the recording tap.

Classes/Audio.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_Wirefr.name: recordingEndedSuccessfully()
Classes/Audio.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_Wirefr.abstract: If the recording succeeded store the URL of the recorded clip then call performeSegue. Else notify the user that recording failed.

Classes/CustomUITextField.html#/s:vC17Ph.name: leftImage
Classes/CustomUITextField.html#/s:vC17Ph.abstract: This variable is the leftImage itself. When it is set, or changed, it calles updateView.

Classes/CustomUITextField.html#/s:vC17Ph.name: leftPadding
Classes/CustomUITextField.html#/s:vC17Ph.abstract: This CGFloat represents the padding between the UIImageView and the text.

Classes/CustomUITextField.html#/s:vC17Ph.name: color
Classes/CustomUITextField.html#/s:vC17Ph.abstract: Tint color for the UIImageView. When this is set, updateView is called.

Classes/CustomUITextField.html#/s:FC17Ph.name: leftViewRect(forBounds:)
Classes/CustomUITextField.html#/s:FC17Ph.abstract: This function moves the textField x-origin component of UITextField by leftPadding.

Classes/CustomUITextField.html#/s:FC17Ph.name: awakeFromNib()
Classes/CustomUITextField.html#/s:FC17Ph.abstract: This method is overridden to set leftViewMode to UITextFieldViewMode.always.

Classes/CustomUITextField.html#/s:FC17Ph.name: updateView()
Classes/CustomUITextField.html#/s:FC17Ph.abstract: This function updates all of the views within the UITextField object. It creates insets for the UIImage provided in leftImage then sets the imageView as well as it’s properties such as the tintColor and contentMode.

Classes/GeneralUIViewController.html#/s:.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/GeneralUIViewController.html#/s:.abstract: Customize appearance of the UIViewController object when this function is called. The theme enforces the background color as well as the appearance of the navigationController by calling setBottomBorderColor with color (@param) set to UIColor.CREME and height (@param) set to 0.25. Finally it creates a new UIBarButtonItem such that the Back Button shows only an arrow to signifiy return.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: noiseLevelLabel
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A dynamic GeneralUILabel that displays the Noise Level.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: dbLabel
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A static GeneralUILabel that displays the dB Unit.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: silentLabel
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A static GeneralUILabel that captions the silent UIView.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: quietLabel
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A static GeneralUILabel that captions the quiet UIView.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: averageLabel
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A static GeneralUILabel that captions the average UIView.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: noisyLabel
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A static GeneralUILabel that captions the noisy UIView.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: loudLabel
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A static GeneralUILabel that captions the loud UIView.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: noiseMeterViewOne
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A static UIView that is colored UIColor.BLUE to represent the ‘silent’ noise range.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: noiseMeterViewTwo
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A static UIView that is colored UIColor.GREEN to represent the ‘quiet’ noise range.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: noiseMeterViewThree
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A static UIView that is colored UIColor.PURPLE to represent the ‘average’ noise range.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: noiseMeterViewFour
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A static UIView that is colored UIColor.ORANGE to represent the ‘noisy’ noise range.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: noiseMeterViewFive
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A static UIView that is colored UIColor.RED to represent the ‘loud’ noise range.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: recorder
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: The recorder object on which the noise meter relies.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: levelTimer
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A timer object to gathers noise data frequently.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: dBs
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: An array to store the recorded noise levels. This can possibly be used to display a history graph of the past noise levels.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: viewWillAppear(_:)
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: Calls setupNoiseMeter to color all of the UIViews to make them look like a legend for the noiseLevelLabel.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: This function sets up custom UI Elements specific to this view then calls setupAVAudioSession to set up the audio session that measures noise.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: setupAVAudioSession()
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: Creates an AVAudioSession as a sharedInstance then requests recording permission from the user. If the user allows recording, the AVAudioSession has settings changed and the record method is called.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: record(filename:settings:metered:timeIntervalForResults:)
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A function that allows the recorder to record storing the file at filename (@param), with settings settings (@param), a flag to determine if the recording should be metered, and a timeInterval for levelTimer.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: levelTimerCallback()
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: The callback function for levelTimer. This allows the view to be updated with the new noise levels: recorder calls updateMeters and updateLabels is called to update the view.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: updateLabels(dB:)
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: This function changes the text in the noiseLevelLabel and sets the color of the text based on the NoiseMeterColors.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: convertToDecibel(originalValue:)
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: Converts from Apple standard noise levels to the universally used decibel system. Changes values from a linear [-160, 0] scale to a logrithmic [0, 120] scale.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: setupNoiseMeter()
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: This function sets up the different small UIViews that create the NoiseMeter at the top of this UIView. Also sets the font for the labels that describe each color of the meter.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: audioRecorderDidFinishRecording(_:successfully:)
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: Ensures that when the recording ends a sucess or failure flag is sent to recordingEnded function.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: recordingEnded(success:)
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: Prints whether or not the recording session ended correctly.

Classes/GeneralUITextField.html#/s:FC17P.name: awakeFromNib()
Classes/GeneralUITextField.html#/s:FC17P.abstract: Customize appearance of the UITextField object when this function is called. The theme enforces the background, placeholder text, and typed in text colors. Furthermore, a specific font is applied to the text that appears in this UITextField. Background Color is set to UIColor.CHARCOAL. Placeholder Text Color is set to UIColor.CREME. Text Color is set to UIColor.WHITE. Font is set to UIFont.TEXTFIELD. This will ensure that all GeneralUITextField objects will have the same appearance.

Classes/AppDelegate.html#/s:vC17Phase_1_.name: window
Classes/AppDelegate.html#/s:vC17Phase_1_.abstract: The AppDelegate window. This variable contains information regarding the placment of the Application itself on the phone screen. The rootViewController for this variable will be the InitialViewController.

Classes/AppDelegate.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_.name: application(_:didFinishLaunchingWithOptions:)
Classes/AppDelegate.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_.abstract: The Navigation Bar’s appearance is set in this function. Since the entire application will be using the same Navigation bar, setting it here will affect all other views.

Classes/AppDelegate.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_.name: applicationWillResignActive(_:)
Classes/AppDelegate.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_.abstract: Sent when the application is about to move from active to inactive state. This can occur for certain types of temporary interruptions (such as an incoming phone call or SMS message) or when the user quits the application and it begins the transition to the background state. Use this method to pause ongoing tasks, disable timers, and invalidate graphics rendering callbacks. Games should use this method to pause the game.

Classes/AppDelegate.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_.name: applicationDidEnterBackground(_:)
Classes/AppDelegate.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_.abstract: Use this method to release shared resources, save user data, invalidate timers, and store enough application state information to restore your application to its current state in case it is terminated later. If your application supports background execution, this method is called instead of applicationWillTerminate: when the user quits.

Classes/AppDelegate.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_.name: applicationWillEnterForeground(_:)
Classes/AppDelegate.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_.abstract: Called as part of the transition from the background to the active state; here you can undo many of the changes made on entering the background.

Classes/AppDelegate.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_.name: applicationDidBecomeActive(_:)
Classes/AppDelegate.html#/s:FC17Phase_1_.abstract: Restart any tasks that were paused (or not yet started) while the application was inactive. If the application was previously in the background, optionally refresh the user interface.

Classes/GeneralUITableView.html#/s:FC17P.name: awakeFromNib()
Classes/GeneralUITableView.html#/s:FC17P.abstract: Customize appearance of the UITableView object when this function is called. The theme enforces the seperatorStyle, estimatedRowHeight, allowsSelection and backgroundColor to be consistent among all GeneralUITableView objects.

Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:v.name: recordingLabel
Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:v.abstract: The GeneralUILabel that displays if in record mode.

Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:v.name: state
Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:v.abstract: The state of the recorder -> true if recording, false if paused or stopped.

Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.name: viewWillAppear(_:)
Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.abstract: Hide stopButton and recordingLabel. This must be done since the user should not be able to stop the recording before it even starts.

Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.abstract: Set the state and font of the recordingLabel. Call setupAVAudioSession to initiate the recording process.

Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.name: viewWillDisappear(_:)
Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.abstract: Set the state so that it does not keep getting modified.

Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.name: prepare(for:sender:)
Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.abstract: Overridden to send RecordedAudioObject to the next GeneralUIViewController that we are seguing to. In this case the only possible segue is to EqualizerViewController.

Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.name: audioRecorderDidFinishRecording(_:successfully:)
Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.abstract: Ensures that when the recording ends a sucess or failure flag is sent to recordingEnded function.

Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.name: toggleRecording(_:)
Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.abstract: Toggle the state - this function handles the logic of switching the state as well as toggling the visibility for different views.

Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.name: stopRecording(_:)
Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.abstract: Stops recording by invoking the AVAudioRecorder's stop method on Audio.sharedInstance.recorder.

Classes/GeneralUILabel.html#/s:FC17Phase.name: awakeFromNib()
Classes/GeneralUILabel.html#/s:FC17Phase.abstract: Customize appearance of the UILabel object when this function is called. The theme enforces the text color and font. This will ensure that all GeneralUILabel objects will have the same appearance.

Classes/GeneralUITableViewCell.html#/s:F.name: awakeFromNib()
Classes/GeneralUITableViewCell.html#/s:F.abstract: Customize appearance of the UITableViewCell object when this function is called. The theme enforces the backgroundColor to be consistent among all GeneralUITableViewCell objects.

Classes/LoginViewController.html#/s:vC17.name: tableView
Classes/LoginViewController.html#/s:vC17.abstract: This table view sets up simple scrolling and reusable cells to simplify view layouts. This solution is more elegant than implementing a scroll view.

Classes/LoginViewController.html#/s:FC17.name: numberOfSections(in:)
Classes/LoginViewController.html#/s:FC17.abstract: Returns the number of sections in this tableView.

Classes/LoginViewController.html#/s:FC17.name: tableView(_:heightForRowAt:)
Classes/LoginViewController.html#/s:FC17.abstract: Returns the height of a given cell based on indexPath.

Classes/LoginViewController.html#/s:FC17.name: tableView(_:numberOfRowsInSection:)
Classes/LoginViewController.html#/s:FC17.abstract: Returns the number of rows in this tableView.

Classes/LoginViewController.html#/s:FC17.name: tableView(_:cellForRowAt:)
Classes/LoginViewController.html#/s:FC17.abstract: Returns the cell using a reusable identifier based on the indexPath.

Classes/LoginViewController.html#/s:FC17.name: tableView(_:didSelectRowAt:)
Classes/LoginViewController.html#/s:FC17.abstract: Unselects a row after it is selected by the user. This tableview does not need selection.

Classes/InitialViewController.html#/s:vC.name: createAccountButton
Classes/InitialViewController.html#/s:vC.abstract: A button for the user to create an account.

Classes/InitialViewController.html#/s:vC.name: logInButton
Classes/InitialViewController.html#/s:vC.abstract: A button for the user to login with existing credentails.

Classes/InitialViewController.html#/s:vC.name: demoToolsButton
Classes/InitialViewController.html#/s:vC.abstract: A button to skip sign in and account creation to test the tools.

Classes/InitialViewController.html#/s:vC.name: logoImageView
Classes/InitialViewController.html#/s:vC.abstract: An imageView that displays the company’s logo.

Classes/InitialViewController.html#/s:vC.name: logoLabel
Classes/InitialViewController.html#/s:vC.abstract: A label to display the company’s name.

Classes/InitialViewController.html#/s:vC.name: toolsPromptLabel
Classes/InitialViewController.html#/s:vC.abstract: A label to ask the user if they would like to continue without signing in. This gets hidden if the user signs in.

Classes/InitialViewController.html#/s:vC.name: loginPrompt
Classes/InitialViewController.html#/s:vC.abstract: A label to ask the user if they would like to log in. This gets hidden if the user signs in.

Classes/InitialViewController.html#/s:FC.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/InitialViewController.html#/s:FC.abstract: Configure UIElements of the view. This sets the colors for the different buttons and the tint color for the ImageViews.

Classes/InitialViewController.html#/s:FC.name: viewWillAppear(_:)
Classes/InitialViewController.html#/s:FC.abstract: Hides the navigation bar since it would look strange in the initial view with which the user is presented.

Classes/InitialViewController.html#/s:FC.name: viewWillDisappear(_:)
Classes/InitialViewController.html#/s:FC.abstract: Reshow the navigation bar since it is an important part of other views.

Classes/SignUpViewController.html#/s:vC1.name: tableView
Classes/SignUpViewController.html#/s:vC1.abstract: This table view sets up simple scrolling and reusable cells to simplify view layouts. This solution is more elegant than implementing a scroll view.

Classes/SignUpViewController.html#/s:FC1.name: numberOfSections(in:)
Classes/SignUpViewController.html#/s:FC1.abstract: Returns the number of sections in this tableView.

Classes/SignUpViewController.html#/s:FC1.name: tableView(_:heightForRowAt:)
Classes/SignUpViewController.html#/s:FC1.abstract: Returns the height of a given cell based on indexPath.

Classes/SignUpViewController.html#/s:FC1.name: tableView(_:numberOfRowsInSection:)
Classes/SignUpViewController.html#/s:FC1.abstract: Returns the number of rows in this tableView.

Classes/SignUpViewController.html#/s:FC1.name: tableView(_:cellForRowAt:)
Classes/SignUpViewController.html#/s:FC1.abstract: Returns the cell using a reusable identifier based on the indexPath.

Classes/SignUpViewController.html#/s:FC1.name: tableView(_:didSelectRowAt:)
Classes/SignUpViewController.html#/s:FC1.abstract: Unselects a row after it is selected by the user. This tableview does not need selection.

Classes/RecordedAudioObject.html#/s:vC17.name: filePathUrl
Classes/RecordedAudioObject.html#/s:vC17.abstract: An absolute path to a given file.

Classes/RecordedAudioObject.html#/s:vC17.name: title
Classes/RecordedAudioObject.html#/s:vC17.abstract: The last component of the url, the name for the file.

Classes/SignUpTableViewCell.html#/s:vC17.name: textField
Classes/SignUpTableViewCell.html#/s:vC17.abstract: CustomUITextField where the user can specify email, phone number or password.

Classes/EqualizerViewController.html#/s:.name: mainButton
Classes/EqualizerViewController.html#/s:.abstract: This button allows the user to toggle between Record and Stop mode if in real time, otherwise it will allow toggling between Play and Pause mode.

Classes/EqualizerViewController.html#/s:.name: realTime
Classes/EqualizerViewController.html#/s:.abstract: A flag used to represent if in realTime or if audio clip was recorded on the previous GeneralUIViewConroller.

Classes/EqualizerViewController.html#/s:.name: state
Classes/EqualizerViewController.html#/s:.abstract: If in realTime, this flag determines if the class is in record mode or stop mode. If not in realTime, this flag determines if the class is in play mode or pause mode.

Classes/EqualizerViewController.html#/s:.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/EqualizerViewController.html#/s:.abstract: Check if user recorded clip or if they want to use real-time recording. Set the value for realTime based on if recordedAudio is nil. Once realTime is set, setupEqualizer is called.

Classes/EqualizerViewController.html#/s:.name: viewWillDisappear(_:)
Classes/EqualizerViewController.html#/s:.abstract: Remove notification observers when view will disappear.

Classes/EqualizerViewController.html#/s:.name: failedToGetDesiredNumberOfChannels()
Classes/EqualizerViewController.html#/s:.abstract: This function is called as a callback function in the case that the number of channels requested from the tapped input is less than 2.

Classes/EqualizerViewController.html#/s:.name: updateGains()
Classes/EqualizerViewController.html#/s:.abstract: This function is called every time a VerticalSlider changes. It updates the actual gain values within each equalizer.

Classes/EqualizerViewController.html#/s:.name: finishedPlayingClip()
Classes/EqualizerViewController.html#/s:.abstract: This is a callback function to update UIElements after the clip finishes playing.

Classes/EqualizerViewController.html#/s:.name: toggleAudio(_:)
Classes/EqualizerViewController.html#/s:.abstract: This IBAction is called by mainButton. Based on realTime and state, it manages setting the imageView for mainButton. As well as changing state for future toggles.

Classes/EqualizerTableViewCell.html#/s:v.name: row
Classes/EqualizerTableViewCell.html#/s:v.abstract: This property gets set by each cell’s parent GeneralUITableView. When it gets set, the cell decides how to label the VerticalSlider objects and what color they will be. Calls updateSelf.

Classes/EqualizerTableViewCell.html#/s:F.name: awakeFromNib()
Classes/EqualizerTableViewCell.html#/s:F.abstract: Sets the font for all GeneralUILabel objects. Also adds a target to each VerticalSlider that calls EqualizerViewController.updateGains which results in the equalizers pulling data from the VerticalSlider objects to set the different frequency’s gain levels.

Classes/EqualizerTableViewCell.html#/s:F.name: updateSelf()
Classes/EqualizerTableViewCell.html#/s:F.abstract: This function is invoked when row gets set by the parent GeneralUITableView. It sets the tint color for the VerticalSlider objects as well as the text for each GeneralUILabel based on the row value.

Classes/EqualizerTableViewCell.html.name: EqualizerTableViewCell
Classes/EqualizerTableViewCell.html.abstract: Custom GeneralUITableViewCell made for the EqualizerTableView. These cells contain VerticalSlider objects that allow the user to control gain on different frequencies for an equalizer.

Classes/EqualizerViewController.html.name: EqualizerViewController
Classes/EqualizerViewController.html.abstract: This GeneralUIViewController controls the equalizer view. It allows the user to either stream real time audio from the microphone to the speaker after passing through a dual-channel equalizer. There are a total of 28 VerticalSlider objects that the user can control in order to change the gain at any given frequency.

Classes/SignUpTableViewCell.html.name: SignUpTableViewCell
Classes/SignUpTableViewCell.html.abstract: The GeneralUITableViewCell objects that appear in the SignupTableView. This custom class has IBOutlets for buttons, labels, and text fields.

Classes/RecordedAudioObject.html.name: RecordedAudioObject
Classes/RecordedAudioObject.html.abstract: This is a custom model that allows to store both a URL and a title for an audio clip.

Classes/SignUpViewController.html.name: SignUpViewController
Classes/SignUpViewController.html.abstract: This GeneralUIViewController controls the sign up view. It allows the user to create an account through Facebook, Google, E-mail, or Phone.

Classes/InitialViewController.html.name: InitialViewController
Classes/InitialViewController.html.abstract: Controls the initial view with which the user is presented.

Classes/LoginViewController.html.name: LoginViewController
Classes/LoginViewController.html.abstract: This GeneralUIViewController controls the login view. It allows the user to login through Facebook, Google, E-mail, or Phone.

Classes/GeneralUITableViewCell.html.name: GeneralUITableViewCell
Classes/GeneralUITableViewCell.html.abstract: This type was created to ensure that all of the UITableViewCell objects are created consistently. This class allows the developer to easily apply a ‘theme’ across all of the GeneralUITableViewCell objects

Classes/APIManager.html.name: APIManager
Classes/APIManager.html.abstract: This is a custom model that allows to store both a URL and a title for an audio clip.

Classes/GeneralUILabel.html.name: GeneralUILabel
Classes/GeneralUILabel.html.abstract: This type was created to ensure that all of the UILabel objects are created consistently. This class allows the developer to easily apply a ‘theme’ across all of the GeneralUILabel objects

Classes/RecorderViewController.html.name: RecorderViewController
Classes/RecorderViewController.html.abstract: This GeneralUIViewController controls the Equalizer’s recorder view. It allows the user to prerecord an audio clip if they do not want to use the equalizer in real-time.

Classes/GeneralUITableView.html.name: GeneralUITableView
Classes/GeneralUITableView.html.abstract: This type was created to ensure that all of the UITableView objects are created consistently. This class allows the developer to easily apply a ‘theme’ across all of the GeneralUITableView objects

Classes/GeneralUITextField.html.name: GeneralUITextField
Classes/GeneralUITextField.html.abstract: This type was created to ensure that all of the UITextField objects are created consistently. This class allows the developer to easily apply a ‘theme’ across all of the GeneralUITextField objects

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html.name: NoiseMeterViewController
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html.abstract: A custom class that inherits from GeneralUIViewController and AVAudioRecorderDelegate. It was created to control the NoiseMeterView.

Classes/GeneralUIViewController.html.name: GeneralUIViewController
Classes/GeneralUIViewController.html.abstract: This type was created to ensure that all of the UIViewController objects are created consistently. This class allows the developer to easily apply a ‘theme’ across all of the GeneralUIViewController objects

Classes/CustomUITextField.html.name: CustomUITextField
Classes/CustomUITextField.html.abstract: This class was designed to allow the programmer to insert an imageView on the left side of a GeneralUITextField

Classes/Audio.html.name: Audio
Classes/Audio.html.abstract: A singleton class to help abstract function calls and methods for setting up different AVFoundation components.

Classes/GeneralUIButton.html.name: GeneralUIButton
Classes/GeneralUIButton.html.abstract: This type was created to ensure that all of the UIButton objects are created consistently. This class allows the developer to easily apply a ‘theme’ across all of the GeneralUIButton objects
